data.title: Disable incompatible custom maps during load
data.body:
Many maps with custom rules are broken whenever a major new version is released.  We should be filtering these at load-time if they don't explicitly state that they are compatible with the runtime mod version.

I can see two ways of doing this:
- Adding a `RequiresVersion:` key after RequiresMod. #4058
- Integrate this with the syntax for extracting rules into the map package, allowing different rules to be specified for each mod version. e.g.:

```
Rules:
    Compat.yaml: release-20130514
    Release.yaml: release-20130915
    Playtest.yaml: playtest-20131215, playtest-20131211
```

data.body: This allows multiple harv/proc type pairs, requested in #4323.

data.title: Allow mods to define a list of compatible map sources.
data.body:
Fixes #4319.

A worked example:

```
MapFolders:
    ./mods/cnc/maps
    ~^/maps/cnc
    ./mods/fgtn/maps

SupportsMapsFrom: cnc
```

data.title: Update AUTHORS
Avoid crashing the game for things that users can affect?
data.body:
There are always cheaters or bad losers who do anything to spoil the game for everyone if the outcome of the game isn't what they wanted.

This is the main reason why crashes shouldn't be allowed for things on which the users can affect with tools or OpenRA itself.

The other reason is that we players can't know every possible crash, so we are afraid to try things that aren't expected, because unexpected behaviour results into a crash. Just like the Dog-bug I found recently; nobody thought of trying to attack barrels with a dog before, or they were just afraid to do so.

Currently this is all we can do:
![Praying](http://i6.minus.com/ibjvmEihHDTjrH.jpg)

As an atheist I know that praying isn't going to fix anything, but it's all we have now.

I have looked up the player activity stats and the future isn't pretty: players are going away from this game at a constant rate. There are now half the amount of players as there were 1-2 years ago.

Would Angry Birds (or other popular games) have got over billion downloads if it crashed (or froze) in 50% of the games you play?

data.title: Game crashes when joining server with unknown map
data.body:
There are half a dozen of servers with unknown map which causes my OpenRA to crash when i join those servers.

Never happened before. So i assume someone is exploiting an "expected behaviour" features (=crash with love) and preventing people from playing this game.

```
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowKeyNotFoundException()
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.LobbyLogic.UpdateCurrentMap()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.Game.SyncLobbyInfo()
   at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder(OrderManager orderManager, World world, Int32 clientId, Order order)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey36.<>m__72()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Using 2 types of refineries and harvesters for Tiberium and Ore - Tiberium harvester can drop off at Ore Refinery and vice versa.
data.body:
In my mod (Tiberium Origins) I have implemented the Tiberium Refinery and Harvester for Tiberium and Ore Refinery / Ore Truck for ore and gems. The problem is:
- Ore Truck can dump resources at the Tiberium Refinery. 
- Tiberium Harvester can dump resources at the Ore Refinery (with non corresponding unload animation)

Could you please implement a feature / switch / trait that forces a harvester type to unload ONLY at it's corresponding refinery type? (like a DumpsResourceAt: (actor) trait) 

Example: 

HARV:            #Ore truck

```
  Harvester:
    DumpsResourceAt: PROC 
    Resources: Ore,Gems
    PipCount: 7
    Capacity: 20
    LoadTicksPerBale: 6
    UnloadTicksPerBale: 1
    SearchFromProcRadius: 24
    SearchFromOrderRadius: 12
```

THRV:         #Tiberium harvester

```
   Harvester:
    DumpsResourceAt: TRAF  #tiberium rafinery
    Resources: Tiberium
    PipCount: 7
    Capacity: 20
    LoadTicksPerBale: 6
    UnloadTicksPerBale: 12
    SearchFromProcRadius: 24
    SearchFromOrderRadius: 12
```

data.title: Possibly broken ubuntu package

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
I've seen multiple reports of this exception now:

```
    Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.2.0.57)
    Runtime Version: Mono 2.10.8.1 (Debian 2.10.8.1-1ubuntu2.2) CLR 2.0.50727.1433
    Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
      at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
      at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
      at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
    Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.2.0.57)
    Runtime Version: Mono 2.10.8.1 (Debian 2.10.8.1-1ubuntu2.2) CLR 2.0.50727.1433
    Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at OpenRA.Program.FatalError (System.Exception e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
      at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

We should verify whether the package is broken under the 12.04 LTS, or this may be a machine-specific issue.

data.title: RequiresMod in maps breaks mod inheritance

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Mods that inherit and extend RA / C&C are no longer able to inherit their maps, which is a rather serious problem (who wants to play a mod that has no maps?).

I'd rather not disable the RequiresMod check (it is otherwise a good thing, IMO), but we could define a MapCompatibility property in mod.yaml which can define additional values for this check.

data.title: Added the Atreides grenadier
data.body:
Was part of the 1.06 (christmas) patch http://web.archive.org/web/20000229040341/http://www.westwood.com/corporate/press/c_pr98_019.html for Dune 2000 http://dune2k.com/Duniverse/Games/Dune2000/Downloads/Patches However this can also be merged after the release.

The sprite is an old file from http://content.open-ra.org/index.php?p=detail&table=units&id=328 when the R8  PNG  SHP(TD) conversion was done half-automatically. This is now broken because we export R8 into frames with different dimensions which SHP(TD) does not support. I also failed to rip the parts I need from 1.06 DATA.R8 with https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/compare/file-position and a hex editor.

data.title: Proposal: make JEEP, ARTI, FLAK, TRUK and 1TNK transportable with TRAN
data.body:
Hi, before I make any changes in this direction I would like to discuss this:

I propose to let JEEP, ARTI, FLAK, TRUK and 1TNK be transportable with TRAN. The motivation behind this is simple: Give the allied player an alternative route for harassment. Of course, each TRAN would be capable to transport one vehicle.

I guess the best way to implement this would be the creation of a vehicles-light.yaml file and a VehiclesLight vehicle class, as add the _Passenger: Weight: big number_ to vehicles that should not be allowed to be air-lifted will affect their capability to be transported by sea. Any better ideas? Comments?

data.title: Game hangs joining a server with unknown map when content site is not available
HealthRadius of 10 unfitting for large buildings
data.body:
Right now, even large buildings like Construction Yards are technically no easier to hit than silos, defenses or standing vehicles.

This is not only unrealistic, but also not in line with the original, where a direct hit to any cell occupied by a building would deal full damage.

My suggestion would be to give buildings sized 2x2 and larger appropriate HealthRadiuses, but of course in terms of balancing that might open a can of worms initially because inaccurate artillery weapons would become much more effective against large buildings, so this would need quite a bit of testing and fine-tuning.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1358993-healthradius-of-10-unfitting-for-large-buildings?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
